column4: I have install scrot but when I try to take one it says: giblib error: saving to /home/yorak/blah failed.
I have install scrot but when I try to take one it says: giblib error: saving to /home/yorak/blah failed.
there is no need to repeat your question like that
I know you've been asking for a while, no one probably knows the answer.  Try posting at ubuntuforums.org or searching wiki.ubuntu.com
do you think it's feasible to have 600 people respond ``I don't know'' to every question?
very easy, just take a look at the link in your private messages from ubotu
you will see that gaim-extendedprefs is available through synaptic
(provided you have enabled universe)  do you know how to do that?
have you enabled universe?
yes.  Have you enabled universe?
search for gaim.  A package called ``gaim-extendedprefs'' will appear.  right click on it, install, then press apply at the top
The repository?
yes, if you have enabled the universe repository, what I said last should work for you
Yes, I have that repository. But that package doesn't appear in there.
can you do this in a terminal 'gedit /etc/apt/sources.list' and copy and paste the contents to http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/ , then give me a url?
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/11190
you are using dapper
So can you give me the extra repositories from 5.10 to add in it?
well gaim-extendedprefs is in dapper universe too.  you must just not be seeing it.  Why don't you try 'sudo aptitude install gaim-extendedprefs' in the terminal
please close synaptic before running that command by the way
It couldn't find an application with that name.
I can't find alot with sudo apt-search either, am I missing repositories?

you have all the communities ones except multiverse.  the gaim package you want though should be in there.  Can you do 'sudo aptitude update' and then try again.  If it fails again, can you pastebin the command along with the output?
did it work this time?  I am about to go
